title.narrative: 204 WATER SANITATION AND HYGIEN

description.narrative: COs and partners are supported by ROSA to decrease open defecation, improve and sustain water, sanitation and hygiene services and systems in times of stability and crisis through strengthened enabling environments enhanced accountability and the establishment of new social norms and robust Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) behaviours., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Comprehensive, sustainable and enabling environment that leaves no child behind is supported by policies, programmes, strategies, budgets and actions of Governments, regional institutions, private sector, media, financial institutions, UN and UNICEF country programmes in South Asia, in development and humanitarian contexts.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: COs and partners are supported by ROSA to decrease open defecation, improve and sustain water, sanitation and hygiene services andsystems in times of stability and crisis; through strengthened enabling environments; enhanced accountability and the establishmentof new social norms and robust WASH behaviours.

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has continued to impact on both WASH programme priorities and implementation across countries; the emphasis on WASH and IPC in schools has remained a priority as countries have adopted strategies to reopen schools. Strong focus and learning on hand hygiene has continued, with most countries developing Hand Hygiene Roadmaps to ensure prioritisation of hand hygiene in WASH implementation plans. Despite implementation challenges, progress has continued in reducing open defecation and increasing access to climate resilient water services across countries, with increased attention to sustainability and continuity of services.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2021
